title: Amazon Breaks Record for One-Day Gain in Market Cap
summary: Tech stocks have diverged this earnings season as investors subject results to greater scrutiny. Investors in big technology stocks have a serious case of whiplash.

title: Delta Seeks to Put Unruly Passengers on 'No-Fly' List
summary: CEO Ed Bastian says there should be 'zero tolerance' for any behavior that affects flight safety. NEW YORK- Delta Air Lines has requested that the Justice Department put any person convicted of a disruption on board a flight on the national "no fly" list.

title: More Than 100,000 People Without Power as Winter Storm Heads to Sea
summary: Areas from Tennessee to New England are recovering; cold is forecast to start easing Sunday. More than 100,000 people were without power Saturday after a winter storm dropped snow and ice from Tennessee to New England.

title: Hackers Targeted News Corp's Tech Suppliers
summary: Investigators believe hackers accessed emails and documents to aid Chinese intelligence. Hackers with suspected links to China targeted News Corp's third-party technology suppliers, according to a company filing.

title: How to Prepare for Student-Loan Payments Restarting
summary: Borrowers need to understand their options, and have a game plan. Borrowers of federal student loans need to get ready to start making payments again. The current suspension of federal student-loan repayments was extended through May 1. It's possible that the pandemic-inspired suspension, in effect since early 2020, could be extended. The government also could cancel certain student-loan debt entirely, as some advocates are pressing for. But, meanwhile, borrowers need a game plan.

title: Israel, U.A.E. Draw Closer on Security Amid Threat From Iran, Its Allies
summary: The two nations are discussing new ways to protect Persian Gulf state after attacks on Abu Dhabi. Israel and the United Arab Emirates are accelerating their security and intelligence cooperation efforts in the wake of a series of attacks on Abu Dhabi by Tehran-backed militants in Yemen that have triggered new concerns about the threat posed by Iran and its allies.

title: Uyghur Torchbearer Evokes Memories of 2008 Games
summary: Fourteen years apart, two from Xinjiang carried the flame. One is now in the U.S., with his father in prison.. It was a politically charged message. A smiling Uyghur woman gripped the Olympic torch to open the Winter Games on Friday in Beijing. To another Uyghur, who ran with the Olympic flame 14 years ago, it seemed to be "an elevated form of puppetry."

title: China Wins Its First Gold Medal, in Short-Track Speedskating
summary: The host nation claimed the top spot in the mixed team relay in a dramatic finish. BEIJING-China won its first gold medal of the Beijing Winter Olympics, after the two men and two women on the world's top-ranked short-track speedskating relay team survived a dramatic Saturday evening in front of a home crowd.

title: What CEOs Are Saying: 'Business Has Come Back Roaring'
summary: Senior executives at UPS, Starbucks, Amazon and other major companies weigh in on inflation, supply-chain issues and the pandemic. title: GOP Lawmakers, Parents Push for Greater School Transparency
summary: Bills seek broader access to class materials; many would bar teaching about issues such as critical race theory and penalize violations. Lawmakers in at least a dozen states are backing bills meant to increase transparency around school curricula, the next iteration of movements under way to bar teachers from promoting concepts perceived as divisive.

title: Proxy Contest Has a Better Chance of Success if the Target CEO Is a Woman
summary: A study also suggests that the gender of the CEO might have consequences for a targeted firm's share price. Individual investors are more likely to support activist campaigns that target female-led companies than those that target male-led companies, according to an experiment done for a new study.

title: White House Sees Hearing Aids as Chance to Lower Prices Through Competition
summary: Reducing regulations for hearing-aid sales is a test case in the Biden administration's push to reduce costs by tackling concentration. Getting a pair of hearing aids can cost up to $5,000. The White House says they should be as little as a few hundred dollars. And it says it has a plan to make that possible: deregulate the market to increase competition.

title: On China Television, Corrupt Officials, Corporate Villains Are Bad Guys
summary: Documentary series on state TV that features public confessions signals more pain for private companies.

title: Teens' Sexy TikTok Videos Take a Mental-Health Toll
summary: Girls are often anxious and overwhelmed by the attention they get after posting suggestive videos; therapists say more are suffering emotionally. When Jula Anderson joined TikTok at age 16, her first video featured her family's home renovations. It got five likes. After seeing others post risqué videos and get more likes, she tried it, too.

title: The Jump of Figure Skating's Wildest Dreams Is Almost Here
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIJING-The first peek at the next frontier of a figure-skating revolution was so unexpected that even some skating diehards weren't in their seats in time to see it.

title: The New Kitten Heel: 7 Ways to Try the Trend
summary: You don't need stilettos to stand out. Kitten heels paired with vibrant socks pump things up a notch.. Shoes don't need to be towering to stand out. This season it's all about lower heels that let the footwear itself take center stage, especially when paired with brightly colored hosiery in different textures and knits. Take a cue from Miu Miu and match soft gray socks with a two-tone mule for a fresh, preppy feel. For something more playful, combine lipstick-red mini heels from Kwaidan Editions combined with sheer turquoise Fogal socks. Bring an architectural bent to your look in Prada's cantilevered yellow pair while keeping it simple with complementary green socks from Comme Si. And for those who only want to dip their toes into the trend, there's the timeless style and demure sensibility of a Mary Jane kitten heel paired with an ankle sock from the likes of Chanel or Celine by Hedi Slimane. Either way, you can't go wrong with the classics. -Jessica Gibbs

title: Team USA Doesn't Have a Starting Goalie. That's By Design.
summary: The U.S. women have three of the best goaltenders in the world and plan to use the trio's versatility as a weapon in Beijing. With shift changes every few minutes and rosters nearly two-dozen strong, hockey is a team sport in the truest sense. But if there's one position the game turns on, it's the goaltender. It is possible to win with offensively powerful forwards. But it's a lot harder to lose when the goalie gets hot and turns into something of a brick wall between the pipes.

title: GameStop Investors Await Riches From Short Squeeze
summary: Short-seller theories that helped drive company's 2021 rally have gained a large following online. Ben Wehrman clocks into his job as a Tesla salesman five days a week. His real work begins when he clocks out at night.

title: Why a Pricier Amazon Prime Is Still Worth It
summary: A Prime membership will now cost you $20 more a year. Here's how it stacks up to the competition in both online shopping and streaming video.. The cost of Amazon Prime just went up. But for many of us, the perks are likely still worth it.

title: SpaceX's Starlink Satellites Are Photobombing Astronomy Images, Study Says
summary: Streaks left by passing satellites mar observatories' celestial images, potentially hinder spotting of dangerous asteroids. As the armada of satellites circling Earth grows, a new study shows that astronomy images are being marred by streaks of reflected sunlight left by the fast-moving objects.

title: Rising Battery Prices Add Uncertainty to Electric-Vehicle Costs
summary: Demand for lithium outstrips supply, ending yearslong price declines. Surging prices for the metals that make up electric-vehicle batteries have ended a decadelong decline that brought the cost of EVs to within spitting distance of gasoline-powered vehicles.

title: Ski Jumping Is Like Golf. (Only Difference Is You're the Ball.)
summary: Olympic ski jumpers say the best way to understand their sport is through another sport. And it's not played on snow.. summary: State court rulings on lawsuits could shape the balance of power in the U.S. House next year. Newly drawn congressional maps in states across the country are facing a wave of novel legal challenges in state courts that could shape the balance of power in the U.S. House next year.

title: Chanel Tests Purse Lovers With $3,000 Price Hikes
summary: Luxury brand cites higher materials costs for raising handbag prices three times in a year. Chanel SA's small Classic Flap bag was always a luxury item, but after three price hikes last year, it is selling for $8,200. That is up from the $5,200 it cost in 2019.

title: Too Risky to Wed in Your 20s? Not if You Avoid Cohabiting First

So what's the best age to put a ring on it?

title: As China Gained Clout, Hollywood Looked for a New Villain
summary: When MGM started work on a reboot of 'Red Dawn,' China was the obvious aggressor. By the time the movie was shot, that decision represented political suicide.. In 2008, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Inc. desperately needed something familiar. The studio was fending off bankruptcy, so executives scoured the studio's library of old movies to see what could be remade. Soon a contender emerged: "Red Dawn."

title: You Might Be Sitting on Extra Cash. Expert Tips on Reselling Furniture
summary: With the resale market hot, it's time to sell the highboy that's been collecting dust in your attic.. A FEW MONTHS AGO furniture flipper Leslie Jarrett of Denver, Colo., found a 12-drawer dresser on Facebook Marketplace for $40. That was pretty much what secondhand, solid-wood case pieces fetched at the beginning of the supply-chain crisis. But before she could slap a coat of primer on it, a neighbor frustrated by an endless wait for a Pottery Barn delivery offered her $400. She sold the piece, of course, but today she says, "I wish I could get it back because I could sell it for $800 now."

title: Pence Calls Trump Wrong in Claiming Vice President Could Overturn Election Result
summary: Cheney, Kinzinger censured by RNC for serving on Jan. 6 committee as GOP rift widens. Former Vice President Mike Pence forcefully rejected former President Donald Trump's repeated claims that Mr. Pence could have overturned the 2020 election outcome during the session of Congress that was interrupted by pro-Trump rioters.

title: Winter Olympics Open in Beijing After Months of Tension
summary: One of the most unusual Games in history began with a parade of masked athletes and a blaze of fireworks. BEIJING-After months of uncertainty and tension, China kicked off one of the most unusual Olympic Games in history with an opening-ceremony spectacle punctuated by what appeared to be a defiant jab at the U.S. and its allies that have challenged the country's human-rights record.

title: Cyberattack on News Corp, Believed Linked to China, Targeted Emails of Journalists, Others
summary: The attack, discovered on Jan. 20, affected units including The Wall Street Journal, the New York Post and the U.K. news operation. News Corp was the target of a hack that accessed emails and documents of journalists and other employees, an incursion the company's cybersecurity consultant said was likely meant to gather intelligence to benefit China's interests.

title: North Carolina's Supreme Court Blocks GOP Redistricting Maps
summary: In a 4-3 decision, the state's high court ordered that maps be redrawn. North Carolina's Supreme Court struck down the voting maps enacted by the Republican-controlled state legislature, saying they violated the state's constitution, in a closely watched case with implications for the balance of political power in the state's legislature and congressional delegation.

title: Ottawa Fears Vaccine Protest Has Morphed Into an Occupation
summary: Resume Subscription. OTTAWA-Police in the Canadian capital are weighing military help or a court order to bring an end to a weeklong protest against vaccine mandates that has forced businesses to close, frayed residents' nerves and strangled swaths of the city's core.

title: Teen Who Tracks Musk in the Sky Wants a Tesla in Exchange for Stopping
summary: Jack Sweeney, a Florida student, says he won't give up his hobby for anything less than his dream car. A college freshman who is publicly tracking the whereabouts of Elon Musk's private jet has one request that would make him halt the endeavor.

title: U.S. to Waive Sanctions on Iran Civilian Nuclear Activities
summary: The sanctions relief is intended to prepare the way for Iran to return to the 2015 nuclear deal. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is waiving sanctions on some of Iran's civilian nuclear activities as it seeks to close a deal with Iran on returning to the 2015 nuclear pact.

title: Art Market Poses Money-Laundering Risks, but Treasury Weighs Against Regulation for Now
summary: A study said other sectors pose higher immediate money-laundering risks, while noting rapid growth of NFTs could pose new outlets for criminal activity. Large-dollar transactions and a culture of privacy make the glamorous world of high-end art susceptible to money laundering, according to a new report by the U.S. Treasury Department. But officials aren't yet recommending comprehensive regulations that would tamp down on the threat.
